cyclone.name: PHILIPPE
cyclone.current_location: about 475 mi (760 km) east of the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting west-southwest through Saturday, then turning west and northwest Sunday–Tuesday, passing east–northeast of the northern Leeward Islands and the Virgin Islands and moving into the open Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: None expected (forecast track remains offshore of all land areas)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Atlantic coasts of the northern Leeward Islands, U.S. & British Virgin Islands, and Puerto Rico will feel swells and outer rain bands
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty winds well below tropical-storm force possible early next week; 34-kt probability only 3%
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring brief heavy showers but widespread totals near St. Croix should stay under 4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along north- and east-facing beaches through the weekend
